commit_message:
Removed the db recipe

The db recipe have been removed. It is up to the operator to
setup the database, users, and grants before deploying openstack.
It has been moved to the `openstack-db` recipe in the
`openstack-ops-database` wrapper cookbook.  Needed to converge
in the register tests, so Chef loads the provider and creates
the classes.  The db spec was previously doing that, which allowed
tests to pass.

Change-Id: I301b7fc625790960efd99d08395b91204ae18107

subject: Added the new rabbit `["openstack"]["mq"]` attributes
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 23:40:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added new rabbit `["openstack"]["mq"]` attributes

After reading over the configuration, rabbit host was being
injected into the templates, however, the `notifier_strategy`
is set to `noop`.  Since mq is not configured in glance,
set the `rabbit_host` flag to the template's default value.
When someone is ready to come along and configure glance w/
rabbit, the attributes are setup properly.

commit_message:
Added the new rabbit `["openstack"]["mq"]` attributes

After reading over the configuration, rabbit host was being
injected into the templates, however, the `notifier_strategy`
is set to `noop`.  Since mq is not configured in glance,
set the `rabbit_host` flag to the template's default value.
When someone is ready to come along and configure glance w/
rabbit, the attributes are setup properly.

Change-Id: I52f3c2b54e3313c48df0f2f0edbdeba72a526171

commit_message:
Create the swift test.conf file for .functests

swift has a set of functional tests that need to run against a swfit.
We install a swift - so we should create the config file that is
needed for the swift functional tests, so that a swift dev could
use devstack.

Change-Id: Ie19eeabfdc39ce68268a95f5c0a0961441599357

commit_message:
Removed the db recipe

The db recipe have been removed. It is up to the operator to
setup the database, users, and grants before deploying openstack.
It has been moved to the `openstack-db` recipe in the
`openstack-ops-database` wrapper cookbook.  Also, remove database
from Berksfile, and pointed berksfile to metadata, like our other
cookbooks.

Change-Id: I79ec1639e950c0016552efe98c1381257c7ab5eb

commit_message:
Change unique constraint in VirtualInterface.

UC on column address changed to (address, deleted).
Used soft_delete instead of delete.
Migrate scripts updated.
Fix bug 1156227.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: I2f9f92cae3c9e49e0f594437d130c1654f76a343

subject: Add -p option to download command.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 05:48:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add -p option to download command.

Allow the ability to download a subset of containers (--all with -p) or
a subset of objects within a container (container name with -p).

This patch also includes a drive-by fix for "download --all" which would
not actually download any objects (for me, at least) because the object
queue got filled with "stop" messages before the container workers had
run long enough to put work in the object queue.  Doh!

I also closed up a few holes where an (unexpected, obviously) Exception
could cause the process to hang because non-daemon threads still
existed.

Change-Id: I71c6935c60282b5353badc2dfce8a935d47e3bb7
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-06-27 06:00:55.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift'], 'message': 'Add -p option to download command.

Allow the ability to download a subset of containers (--all with -p) or
a subset of objects within a container (container name with -p).

This patch also includes a drive-by fix for "download --all" which would
not actually download any objects (for me, at least) because the object
queue got filled with "stop" messages before the container workers had
run long enough to put work in the object queue.  Doh!

I also closed up a few holes where an (unexpected, obviously) Exception
could cause the process to hang because non-daemon threads still
existed.

Change-Id: I71c6935c60282b5353badc2dfce8a935d47e3bb7
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add -p option to download command.

Allow the ability to download a subset of containers (--all with -p) or
a subset of objects within a container (container name with -p).

This patch also includes a drive-by fix for "download --all" which would
not actually download any objects (for me, at least) because the object
queue got filled with "stop" messages before the container workers had
run long enough to put work in the object queue.  Doh!

I also closed up a few holes where an (unexpected, obviously) Exception
could cause the process to hang because non-daemon threads still
existed.

Change-Id: I71c6935c60282b5353badc2dfce8a935d47e3bb7

commit_message:
Finish up v3 role commands

* Add remove role
* Add --role to group list
* Add --role to user list
* Fix groups in AddRole()
* Remove the tweaks to utils.find_resource for domains; will address
  that across domains, projects, users and groups in another patch.
  I want to nail down the structure of these commands and get that into place

Change-Id: I8673dd8221ef88978dada5a2833c187026bdb31a

Implement ability to extend volume.

Implements ability to call extend volume in Version 2 API.

This change includes the needed support in cinderlcient to
utilize/access changes made in the volume-resize change.

subject: Add execute wrapper to brick LVM code.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 19:22:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add execute wrapper to brick LVM code.

Add an execute wrapper to the brick lvm code and
enable the ability to pass in a desired executor other
than just using the default common/processutils executor
if there's some reason to do so.

This will enable the switch of the cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py
driver to continue using cinder/utils execute until we switch over
to common/processutils and also helps immensely with the tests.

Change-Id: Iaecba475debb2100d0c40b5e54ece6d4420271c5
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-02 22:47:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py', 'cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_lvm.py'], 'message': "Add execute wrapper to brick LVM code.

Add an execute wrapper to the brick lvm code and
enable the ability to pass in a desired executor other
than just using the default common/processutils executor
if there's some reason to do so.

This will enable the switch of the cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py
driver to continue using cinder/utils execute until we switch over
to common/processutils and also helps immensely with the tests.

Change-Id: Iaecba475debb2100d0c40b5e54ece6d4420271c5
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add execute wrapper to brick LVM code.

Add an execute wrapper to the brick lvm code and
enable the ability to pass in a desired executor other
than just using the default common/processutils executor
if there's some reason to do so.

This will enable the switch of the cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py
driver to continue using cinder/utils execute until we switch over
to common/processutils and also helps immensely with the tests.

Change-Id: Iaecba475debb2100d0c40b5e54ece6d4420271c5

commit_message:
Alternative queuing policies for swift middleware

This change allow to configure the behavior of swift middleware
when rabbitmq is down.

3 policies are available:
- block: wait until it comes back, all swift requests are stalled
  if rabbit_max_retries <= 0, or return 50X if rabbit_max_retries > 0
- drop: don't publish the sample
- queue: create a local queue of publisher_max_queue_length sample

The default is queue

block is the behavior before this change.

Fixes: bug #1192918
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib0dae8f0ab787cfc2a1ac59517f928fe02bb9eee

commit_message:
Add support for running nova in cells mode

Add the ability to run nova in cells mode.  The only tweak needed is to
set 'n-cell' in the list of enabled services.  This will allow us to
start doing automated testing of nova with cells enabled, which is
currently completed untouched by functional testing.

Change-Id: Id3afb9845654a13ab17a72ed55de0674f3982116

commit_message:
Add H233 check for usages of the print operator

The print operator has been replaced by the print
function in Python 3.x. Starting with Python 2.6,
once can use

from __future__ import print_function

and then also use the Python 3.x compatible print()
function. In cases where only one argument is printed,
just the extra braces are already enough.

Change-Id: I77c62217dbe08c34c497273eb101ff3fd6b1ae5d

commit_message:
Enable client V2 to update/delete tags for a given image.

Added the CLI option image-tag-update to associate a tag to an image via API V2.
Added the CLI option image-tag-delete to delete a tag associated with an image via API V2.

Related to bp glance-client-v2

Change-Id: I76060e1982223770a6c2c0bd9376d568af0df456

[{'created': '2013-07-04 15:32:10.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/cloud_watch.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/tests/utils.py', 'heat/db/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_watch.py', 'heat/engine/watchrule.py'], 'message': 'cleanup watchrule delete logic/tests

Rework watchrule delete interface so we delete by ID, rather than
by name (where we only delete the first rule in the event of multiple
watcherule rows with the same name, which is allowed although not likely
in normal heat operation - it can cause weird behavior in the tests)

Encapsulating the delete in a WatchRule.destroy() is cleaner and more
consistent with the rest of the codebase, and reworking the tests to
ensure proper cleanup reduces the chances of odd errors and cascading
failures between tests on failure.

fixes bug #1197718

Change-Id: I94e9eb610519bb7321a2be7718312fd50f308a8b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
cleanup watchrule delete logic/tests

Rework watchrule delete interface so we delete by ID, rather than
by name (where we only delete the first rule in the event of multiple
watcherule rows with the same name, which is allowed although not likely
in normal heat operation - it can cause weird behavior in the tests)

Encapsulating the delete in a WatchRule.destroy() is cleaner and more
consistent with the rest of the codebase, and reworking the tests to
ensure proper cleanup reduces the chances of odd errors and cascading
failures between tests on failure.

fixes bug #1197718

Change-Id: I94e9eb610519bb7321a2be7718312fd50f308a8b

commit_message:
Adds support for the Indigo Virtual Switch

Allows users to specify which virtual switch Quantum should use
and inform Nova to use. It configures the quantum dhcp agent
interface driver to bind to the correct switch and sets the
vif_type that the BigSwitch/Floodlight plugin will send to Nova.

Change-Id: I077a9ce8ab205e2949e0a438307f7da46a8a247d
Implements: blueprint ivs-support

commit_message:
Rename cinder.flags to cinder.common.config

Replace FLAGS with cfg.CONF
Rename modules fake_flags to conf_fixture, test_flags to test_conf, declare_flags to declare_conf, runtime_flags to runtime_conf
Renamed cinder.flags, because exactly the same was done in the glance and nova

Fixes: bug #1182037
Change-Id: I3424d0a401b3ef7a3254d3e913263554361a52ff

subject: Fix filter-bootps for multiple baremetal nodes.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 09:30:51.000000000', 'files': ['elements/nova-baremetal/bin/filter-bootps'], 'message': 'Fix filter-bootps for multiple baremetal nodes.

The logic of the UDP filters for DHCP requests on baremetal compute
nodes was broken and blocking all traffic when multiple bare metal
nodes are registered.

Change-Id: Ifda611059c6c6f084a04c0616ee108f6b2e720ac
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-05 09:30:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow multiple bm nodes on seed vm

The logic of the UDP filters for dhcp on the seed vm blocks
all requests if more then one MAC address was registered.

Change-Id: Ifda611059c6c6f084a04c0616ee108f6b2e720ac
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix filter-bootps for multiple baremetal nodes.

The logic of the UDP filters for DHCP requests on baremetal compute
nodes was broken and blocking all traffic when multiple bare metal
nodes are registered.

Change-Id: Ifda611059c6c6f084a04c0616ee108f6b2e720ac

commit_message:
Modify the HostState to be more generic.

Changes the HostState to be more generic and extensible to store other
metrics for scheduling purpose, according to
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova-scheduler-HostState.

This is part of the blueprint utilization-aware-scheduling and the
blueprint generic-host-state-for-scheduler.

Change-Id: Ie14e261f54ae590c14c08a3cd8399d7d782e9017

subject: Added a new scheduler resource weight plugin.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-05 08:42:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/test_weights.py', 'nova/scheduler/weights/resources.py'], 'message': "Added a new scheduler resource weight plugin.

The new resource weigher can compute the weight based on the compute
node host's various resources. The to-be weighed resources and their
weighting ratio are specified in the 'scheduler_hints' dictionary of
the API request as the followings:

    'os:scheduler_hints': {
        'weighed_resources': ['name1', 'name2']
        'weighed_ratios': ['1.0', '-1.0']
    }

The final weight would be name1.value * 1.0 + name2.value * -1.0.

This is part of the blueprint utilization-aware-scheduling and the
blueprint generic-host-state-for-scheduler.

Change-Id: I573e493f5f4a713d66aec8f10ca4804cd582d71a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Added a new scheduler resource weight plugin.

The new resource weigher can compute the weight based on the compute
node host's various resources. The to-be weighed resources and their
weighting ratio are specified in the 'scheduler_hints' dictionary of
the API request as the followings:

    'os:scheduler_hints': {
        'weighed_resources': ['name1', 'name2']
        'weighed_ratios': ['1.0', '-1.0']
    }

The final weight would be name1.value * 1.0 + name2.value * -1.0.

This is part of the blueprint utilization-aware-scheduling and the
blueprint generic-host-state-for-scheduler.

Change-Id: I573e493f5f4a713d66aec8f10ca4804cd582d71a

commit_message:
Clean-up some of the workflows-related javascript

 * Initialise the workflows javascript outside modals too

  When opening the Modify Users page into a new window rather than as
  a modal form, the "All Users" and "Project Members" lists would show
  as empty as the javascript for initialising workflow wasn't
  called. Also fix similar problems in other workflows such as Edit
  Security Groups, Launch Instances' network list.

 * Avoid having the projects-specific workflow js initialised on every
   modal init

 * Move the Network List drag & drop to horizon.instances.js as it's
   unrelated to Project workflows

Also:
 * Fix a typo in help text

Fixes bug #1193007

Change-Id: If476d6babf3d93bd6e9abb051008aff4fb393436

commit_message:
Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses SockJS to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

The server hooks into the OpenStack RPC notifications so we need to be
able to configure the RPC backend, etc.

Start the server with:

    ./horizon-realtime.py --config-file etc/horizon/horizon-realtime.conf

To try it out, navigate to http://localhost:8080, log in and go to the
Project -> Instances page. Then launch an instance using the Nova
command line client and try to suspend, resume and delete it from there.

The UI should update automatically.

Implements blueprint realtime-communication

Change-Id: I740bf13a4d14fc27ed3b5b2f3b52eb5024a520d7
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Regression fixes for cell instance builds

Cell scheduler fixes to get instance creation working again:

* Fix location of instance type
* Fix location of security groups
* Scrub non-settable instance values from parent
* Dict-ify system metadata for instance creation

bug 1190404

Change-Id: Ie38e05af894a90a9c8a0adf832dbc31805400f3a

At present, when using timestamp to filter resource or sample data, ceilometer

commit_message:
Filter query op:gt does not work as expected

At present, when using timestamp to filter resource or sample data, ceilometer
is using gte for start_timestamp and lt for end_timestamp.
This fix will pass the timestamp operator in the request to the storage level
to support gt operator for the start_timestamp and le for the end_stamp.

The changes will be applied to the get_resources and get_samples methods of
hbase, mongodb and sqlalchemy.

Change-Id: I3fb7651b588400df804ab8bb522084e766744f96
Fixes: Bug 1193926

subject: Fix scheduler bug when change hostname
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 15:55:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix scheduler bug when change hostname

If we did see below,
1. Start all the cinder services, then change the host name of the cinder
volume and restart cinder volume.
2. Run "cinder create 1".
We should pop incorrect host state in order to avoid improper log warning.

fix bug 1192416

Change-Id: Ica212bbeb2b63985a69b07c3db207a0d34d3a2c1
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix scheduler bug when change hostname

If we did see below,
1. Start all the cinder services, then change the host name of the cinder
volume and restart cinder volume.
2. Run "cinder create 1".
We should pop incorrect host state in order to avoid improper log warning.

fix bug 1192416

Change-Id: Ica212bbeb2b63985a69b07c3db207a0d34d3a2c1

commit_message:
Add unique constraints to Quota.

Added unique constraint 'uniq_quotas0project_id0resource0deleted'
('project_id', 'resource', 'deleted') to Quota model and migrate sripts.
Added new exception `QuotaExists`. Updated quota_create(). Change
quotas duplicates control in create/update code to new DB UC exception.
Tests updated respectively.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Ia615a1c1a7dc75bd19831fcd0acfc9b78c1b3f6f

commit_message:
Add pollster data cache

Add a dictionary as a data cache for the pollsters,
creating it outside of the loop where they are
invoked and passing it to them. Future changesets will
include changes to the pollsters to put data in the
cache.

blueprint one-meter-per-plugin

Change-Id: Ie65526dfe65a8880ad8683b62fae62f8e7f9e69b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Fix flake8 errors

Fix exclude rules so we do not run flake8 against code in the build,
.tox, or openstack/common directories since this code is not "ours."

Fix flake8 errors in other code.

Update the config checker script so if there are differences they
are printed to the output. This should help track down false
negatives in the tests.

Change-Id: I9938846943b7f8aab20f02266b870d560c6a2f80
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Scheduler should not select down volume managers

Currently volume managers that are not disabled, but are not running
may be selected by the scheduler for volume creation operations.

Change-Id: Ia06a3da8b31eef918d55aaaf71f863683c721026
Fixes: bug #1197741

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 08:48:13.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Postgresql is an Optional dependency

psycopg2 is for supporting sqlalchemy connection to
postgresql databases. The tempest testing jobs are allowed to use

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Postgresql is an Optional dependency

psycopg2 is for supporting sqlalchemy connection to
postgresql databases. The tempest testing jobs are allowed to use
the system python librairies so you just need to install your
favourite sql driver.

The mysql driver already removed from the requirements.txt.
This change removes the psql driver dependency.

Change-Id: I8eb972cf404c2a86c8acdb656fc1062fca293299

subject: No support for double nested 64 bit guest using VCDriver
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-29 20:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py'], 'message': 'No support for double nested 64 bit guest using VCDriver

64bit instances launched on ESX via the VCDriver will not
support running 64bit guests. There is an option that can
be passed during the vmx creation that will allow for this
to happen. This is very useful if you want to run hypervisors
 (esx, kvm) on top of ESX and then run 64bit VMs on top of
those hypervisors.

Fixes bug 1192256

Change-Id: Id6eb224c97569737cbb41f1b64f61805e1df004e
(cherry picked from commit 8f6419301e56f7104bc9ac76dcd2ba5aeed0cb43)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
No support for double nested 64 bit guest using VCDriver

64bit instances launched on ESX via the VCDriver will not
support running 64bit guests. There is an option that can
be passed during the vmx creation that will allow for this
to happen. This is very useful if you want to run hypervisors
 (esx, kvm) on top of ESX and then run 64bit VMs on top of
those hypervisors.

Fixes bug 1192256

Change-Id: Id6eb224c97569737cbb41f1b64f61805e1df004e
(cherry picked from commit 8f6419301e56f7104bc9ac76dcd2ba5aeed0cb43)

commit_message:
Enhancements and fixes to various agents

* bugfixes to l3, dhcp, and openvswitch
* plugin lookup fixes for spec tests
* install kernel headers for openvswitch
* add spec tests for openvswitch
* add spec tests for dhcp_agent
* add spec skeleton tests for l3_agent

Change-Id: I68177c191e355dbfced23834a627cca5adf7abee

commit_message:
xenapi: implement xenserver image to volume

Amend image_utils, so that it could handle xenserver type images (vhd
chains inside a tgz archive). This requires the vhd-util binary, if the
image contains a vhd chain (e.g.: snapshot)

DocImpact
- Copy a XenServer type OpenStack image (tgz -ed vhd chain) is now
  supported.
- To use the above functionality, the cinder box must have access to the
  vhd-util binary. In ubuntu, this is done by apt-get installing
  blktap-utils.

Change-Id: I99b58868439c4d5187c2fe3666110bfda0924181

commit_message:
Make os-services API extension consistent

Updates the os-services API extension so that it is consistent
internally (index and update return similar formats), and so
that it works with the following cinderclient code changes which sends
the the following request body format:

  {"binary": "cinder-volume", "host": "host1"}

It addresses a similar issue which happens in nova os-services extention
before. https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1147746

This change added 'binary' key in request and 'status' key in response
while still keeping 'service' ane 'disabled' key for API compatibility
sake.

Implements blueprint os-services-extension

Change-Id: I7f3fa889294ca6caebdf46b8689345bcac1cdf54

commit_message:
Quotas by Volume Type

The VolumeTypeQuotaEngine creates a volume, snapshot, and gigabyte
quota for each volume type that exists, in addition to the existing
global quotas for each. These are queried every time a quota operation
happens.

The resources for creating quotas are named: volumes_<vtype>,
gigabytes_<vtype>, and snapshots_<vtype>.

Another patch will have changes to cinderclient for setting project
quotas by volume type.

blueprint quotas-limits-by-voltype
DocImpact

Change-Id: I88261676edcd6eb5b7cea40654a931f32c00815c

commit_message:
Re-define 'extra' as dict_or_none.

Changed type of 'extra' fields from str_or_none
to dict_or_none for Port and Chassis.

DB model defines 'extra' as a JSONEncodedDict which is
a type decorator that stores a value as a json string
to the database and parses it to a dict when loading the
object. That's why we need to change the type of the
'extra' field from str_or_none to dict_or_none.

Test utils have been modified to simulate behavior of
DB layer better.

Fixes: bug #1194072

subject: Add support for cleanup of libvirt instance logs
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-28 07:42:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters'], 'message': 'Add support for cleanup of libvirt instance logs

* The cleanup is performed during the following API operations:
    * Terminate instance
    * Resize
    * Live migration

* Adds the following:
    * "libvirt_log_path" config parameter in Nova to specify path of the
      instance log files created by libvirt.
    * A CommandFilter for 'rm' command in compute filters
    * Relevant unit tests

Fixes LP bug #1160495

Change-Id: I1ca9c6a0eb7902c60509b9f0723390753df436dc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add support for cleanup of libvirt instance logs

* The cleanup is performed during the following API operations:
    * Terminate instance
    * Resize
    * Live migration

* Adds the following:
    * "libvirt_log_path" config parameter in Nova to specify path of the
      instance log files created by libvirt.
    * A CommandFilter for 'rm' command in compute filters
    * Relevant unit tests

Fixes LP bug #1160495

Change-Id: I1ca9c6a0eb7902c60509b9f0723390753df436dc

commit_message:
Move tests to ceilometerclient.

tests.* implies an incorrect global package name. Additionally,
consuming code can benefit from being able to choose to consume
test code and fixtures.

Change-Id: I7ba2b3ba1c2a99410b54fc40b48dfe2fc53eb79a

Some methods query libvirt to get information that cannot change, so
this commit caches them instead of getting them from the connection.

commit_message:
Add graceful service shutdown support to Launcher

Provides support for letting each running service finish in-progress
requests and cleanup gracefully before stopping.

blueprint graceful-shutdown

Change-Id: Idf137620b87417de89eba23f05daf08780dc9dff

subject: libvirt: Fix spurious backing file existence check.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-01 13:22:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: Fix spurious backing file existence check.

Bug 1195877

The problem lies with the truncation of backing file names at the
first underscore character. On a reboot, nova-compute checks the
backing images exist. Typically, they will do; however, instead
of looking for an "ephemeral_XXX" file, it hunts for "ephemeral".
This won't exist, triggering code that attempts to pull the whole
image again from glance(!)

Lacking credentials, the attempt to fetch the image will fail,
ultimately resulting in the instance going to an ERROR state.

Change-Id: Iabcc7a1ffd248c22a747a1ddc7863d2b386d409a
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-02 14:24:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Fix spurious backing file existence check.

Bug 1195877

The problem lies with the truncation of backing file names at the
first underscore character. On a reboot, nova-compute checks the
backing images exist. Typically, they will do; however, instead
of looking for an "ephemeral_XXX" file, it hunts for "ephemeral".
This won't exist, triggering code that attempts to pull the whole
image again from glance(!)

Lacking credentials, the attempt to fetch the image will fail,
ultimately resulting in the instance going to an ERROR state.

Change-Id: Iabcc7a1ffd248c22a747a1ddc7863d2b386d409a
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix spurious backing file existence check.

Bug 1195877

The problem lies with the truncation of backing file names at the
first underscore character. On a reboot, nova-compute checks the
backing images exist. Typically, they will do; however, instead
of looking for an "ephemeral_XXX" file, it hunts for "ephemeral".
This won't exist, triggering code that attempts to pull the whole
image again from glance(!)

Lacking credentials, the attempt to fetch the image will fail,
ultimately resulting in the instance going to an ERROR state.

Change-Id: Iabcc7a1ffd248c22a747a1ddc7863d2b386d409a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-26 10:58:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix resize ordering for COW VHD

When resizing, the snapshot created by snapshot_attached_here
is still required outside of the with block.  This works by coinidence
because XenServer in OS only supports ext3, which does not support
automatic coalescing by default.  This is in the process of being
changed.

Change-Id: I80fa02ea279839921218655cb6de4e88f595a65b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-03 13:25:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py'], 'message': 'Fix resize ordering for COW VHD

When resizing, the snapshot created by snapshot_attached_here
is still required outside of the with block.  This works by coincidence
because XenServer in OS only supports ext3, which does not support

Change-Id: I80fa02ea279839921218655cb6de4e88f595a65b
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix resize ordering for COW VHD

When resizing, the snapshot created by snapshot_attached_here
is still required outside of the with block.  This works by coincidence
because XenServer in OS only supports ext3, which does not support
automatic coalescing by default.  This is in the process of being
changed.

Change-Id: I80fa02ea279839921218655cb6de4e88f595a65b

subject: Allow non-root ip in subnet CIDR
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 12:29:41.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py'], 'message': "Allow non-root ip in subnet CIDR

If a subnet is created using an IP that isn't a root IP
(doesn't end with .0) the code that handles IP checking
for fixed IPs fails.  This fix changes the check for a
valid IP to use the net.network IP address to
avoid problems in subnets created with the non-root CIDR.

(fixes bug 1188845)

Change-Id: I89df64261d0f2741668576e45dc8f026857f20b0
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-07-04 12:29:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix handling check against non-root ip in subnet CIDR

If a subnet is created using an IP that isn't a root IP
(doesn't end with .0) the code that handles IP checking
for fixed IPs fails.  This fix adds code that applies the
same netmask to the CIDR ip as well as to the IP being
checked to avoid problems in subnets created with the
non-root CIDR.

(fixes bug 1188845)

Change-Id: I89df64261d0f2741668576e45dc8f026857f20b0
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-04 12:29:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix handling check against non-root ip in subnet CIDR

If a subnet is created using an IP that isn't a root IP

for fixed IPs fails.  This fix adds code that applies the
same netmask to the CIDR ip as well as to the IP being
checked to avoid problems in subnets created with the

Change-Id: I89df64261d0f2741668576e45dc8f026857f20b0
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-04 12:29:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix handling check against non-root ip in subnet CIDR

If a subnet is created using an IP that isn't a root IP
(doesn't end with .0) the code that handles IP checking
for fixed IPs fails.  This fix changes the check for a
valid IP to use the net.network IP address to
avoid problems in subnets created with the non-root CIDR.

(fixes bug 1188845)

Change-Id: I89df64261d0f2741668576e45dc8f026857f20b0
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Allow non-root ip in subnet CIDR

If a subnet is created using an IP that isn't a root IP
(doesn't end with .0) the code that handles IP checking
for fixed IPs fails.  This fix changes the check for a
valid IP to use the net.network IP address to
avoid problems in subnets created with the non-root CIDR.

(fixes bug 1188845)

Change-Id: I89df64261d0f2741668576e45dc8f026857f20b0

which use python-2.6 as a default python interpreter.

commit_message:
Added Python-2.6 to the classifier.

OpenStack is often used with dustributions of GNU/Linux
which use python-2.6 as a default python interpreter.
Other OpenStack projects declare compatibility with python-2.6.

Ironic is been continuously tested for compatibility with
python-2.6 so we must declare this in the classifier to
stay synced with other OpenStack services.

Change-Id: Idf296e925c39d2847e7c8d7bfca073b5f9681754

commit_message:
Fix Pep8 issue in H203 check

Pep8 recommends to break after a binary operator, not before.
Although this is not checked by pyp8 1.4.5 at this point,
lets adhere to it anyway.

Change-Id: I8f4ffedb052a0e408f61b784780eb26fd021570d

commit_message:
Cluster scaling implementation

The following is supported:

* Scaling node groups if they contain tasktracker or datanode only
* Add new node group to cluster
* Validation
* Rollback

Implements blueprint manual-cluster-scaling

Change-Id: I3838db4b05afa3583db0d059541c00e75cc6cfe2

commit_message:
Sane rest API rate limit defaults

The previous rate limit defaults were unusable in any deployment.
Rate limiting to 10 POSTS per minute and 50 servers per day seems
to low, especially when we can use quotas to actually limit the amount
of resources a user can consume.

Update docstring to explain what the rate limiting is used for.

Fixes bug 1178529

DocImpact changed default values

Change-Id: I8cc93423f76d9b0a5135adf69babc4ff355a0951

subject: Exeption message of 'live migration' is not appropriate
faster quantum-openvswitch-agent periodic reports
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 06:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_lib.py'], 'message': "faster quantum-openvswitch-agent periodic reports

One of two patches that fixes bug #1194438.

Instead of spawning ovs-vsctl for every port on br-int, we just dump the
required columns from the Interfaces table and grab the rows that we need. This
is a big win because the time it takes for ovs-vsctl to connect to the
openvswitch controller is orders of magnitude greater than the time it takes to
parse the rows. In practice, instead of taking roughly 1s per interface, the
agent's periodic task only takes 1s in total.

Change-Id: Idbf32c38e0c4a9c9634c1e4f0e79bd556b720493
(cherry picked from commit 364e97b44158976dca923bcf9ff5dff926da5dc4)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
faster quantum-openvswitch-agent periodic reports

One of two patches that fixes bug #1194438.

Instead of spawning ovs-vsctl for every port on br-int, we just dump the
required columns from the Interfaces table and grab the rows that we need. This
is a big win because the time it takes for ovs-vsctl to connect to the
openvswitch controller is orders of magnitude greater than the time it takes to
parse the rows. In practice, instead of taking roughly 1s per interface, the
agent's periodic task only takes 1s in total.

Change-Id: Idbf32c38e0c4a9c9634c1e4f0e79bd556b720493
(cherry picked from commit 364e97b44158976dca923bcf9ff5dff926da5dc4)

subject: Add/remove locations from an image.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-04 01:24:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add/remove locations from an image.

This patch modifies the PATCH /v2/images/{id} API call.  Clients
can add and remove locations from the set of multiple locations
associated with a given image ID in the following way:

add: [{"op": "add", "path": "/locations", "value": <url>}]
remove: [{"remove": "add", "path": "/locations", "value": <url>}]

This patch also allows the set of locations to be displayed if
the server is configured with the: show_multiple_locations option.
The paths added are not vetted by the server so this should be
an admin only command.

commit_message:
Add/remove locations from an image.

This patch modifies the PATCH /v2/images/{id} API call.  Clients
can add and remove locations from the set of multiple locations
associated with a given image ID in the following way:

{"op": "add", "path": "/locations", "value": [<list of locations>]}

The entire set of locations will be used replacing whatever previously
existed.

This patch also allows the set of locations to be displayed if
the server is configured with the: show_multiple_locations option.
The paths added are not vetted by the server so this should be
an admin only command.

Change-Id: I5690eb1388450099cb3d8fc6c63b2ffcbe4a9321

commit_message:
Add SockJS dependency

SockJS is API-compatible with WebSocket and the server-side library
supports Python 2 and 3.

Prerequisite for blueprint realtime-communication

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-06-25 01:12:54.000000000', 'files': ['lib/baremetal', 'lib/dib', 'lib/tempest', 'stackrc', 'stack.sh'], 'message': 'Install diskimage-builder, build heat image.

commit_message:
Install diskimage-builder, build heat image.

diskimage-builder and tripleo-image-elements are cloned by default.

Baremetal has been modified to use the installed diskimage-builder
instead of cloning dib itself.

The bash function disk_image_create is provided for building images,
for example to build a heat tempest test image.

Build a heat tempest test image.

This will enable heat tests which rely on a test image being
configured.

It will also take some time to build the image during gating jobs,
until source images are cached on the devstack image.

Change-Id: I8a48fead8c2912a276001f3eb03a318f744d7f5f

Add a tox job to run stress tests.

This adds a tox job that will run the stress tests. It first runs the
server create destroy test for an hour followed by running the volume
create destroy test for another hour.

commit_message:
engine : autoscaling pass instance id's not names to loadbalancer

Regression caused by 4bc1bcb608379cc396113a03f2ae37ce78f9049c

We need to pass the id_list to the loadbalancer, otherwise it
can't lookup the instance IP adresses with nova and the loadbalancer
config ends up with 0.0.0.0 for every instance

Fixes bug #1192128

Change-Id: I73bab70e897c0fb0b317793fa31ff8d07720a6c4

commit_message:
Add object (de)serialization support to cells

This adjusts the cells rpcapi to use the Object serializer class.
This also makes the cells messaging layer, which handles formatting of
cell<->cell messages, serialize objects correctly when contained as
arguments to the cells messaging methods.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Iec328827819f25a16d1fd901f4d6c896525f0bb6

commit_message:
Add cells get_cell_type() method

This moves/consolidates some the deprecated config code for cells into
nova/cells/opts.py and creates a new method to determine the cell_type
that we can use in other places where logic needs to differ depending on
'compute' or 'api' cells.

This also may happen to fix bug 1197091.  I'm unable to reproduce that
bug in tests, unfortunately.

We'll need this soon for some object related conversion.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

subject: Fix flaky test.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 00:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py'], 'message': "Fix flaky test.

test_DELETE_x_container_headers_with_more_container_replicas() would
sometimes fail, and it's because a test helper method was defaulting
to sorting the captured headers by X-Container-Partition. Well, in
tests we use FakeRing, and the partition is always 1, so that sorting
didn't buy us much. Now the sorting is done by X-Container-Device,
which actually differs meaningfully.

Change-Id: Ibe5b2fcd3f23280ed2caaa703111a98861331866
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix flaky test.

test_DELETE_x_container_headers_with_more_container_replicas() would
sometimes fail, and it's because a test helper method was defaulting
to sorting the captured headers by X-Container-Partition. Well, in
tests we use FakeRing, and the partition is always 1, so that sorting
didn't buy us much. Now the sorting is done by X-Container-Device,
which actually differs meaningfully.

Change-Id: Ibe5b2fcd3f23280ed2caaa703111a98861331866

subject: Remove native type prefetches
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-04 02:00:27.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/quantum_router/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum_network/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum_subnet/quantum.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/quantum_router_interface/quantum.rb'], 'message': 'Remove native type prefetches

The network, router, subnet and router interface
providers attempt to prefetch the configuration,
which can result in empty or stale values being
loaded as quantum configuration. The former will
result in errors stating the quantum.conf file
is incomplete, while the latter will often
result in authentication errors.

This patch removes the prefetching in the child
classes and explicitly sets the conf to nil in
the parent quantum provider so that it will be
loaded at the correct time.

Change-Id: Ia2dbc8b687498be96d09c9286fb3f07e0c5b8f96
bug 1197588
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove native type prefetches

The network, router, subnet and router interface
providers attempt to prefetch the configuration,
which can result in empty or stale values being
loaded as quantum configuration. The former will
result in errors stating the quantum.conf file
is incomplete, while the latter will often
result in authentication errors.

This patch removes the prefetching in the child
classes and explicitly sets the conf to nil in
the parent quantum provider so that it will be
loaded at the correct time.

Change-Id: Ia2dbc8b687498be96d09c9286fb3f07e0c5b8f96
bug 1197588

commit_message:
Separate/Link compute config sections

To avoid double maintenance during the documentation restructure
effort, and to further facilitate content sharing, this patch
separates some sections of the compute configuration chapter
into separate files.

Separates vnc into 'using' and 'configuring'.

Add some status notes.

Change-Id: Ia8d1b1a30b63107922939147988ae48bdc71eaa4
bp:restructure-documentation
bp:design-content-sharing

subject: Remove upper bound on python-keystoneclient.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 23:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Remove upper bound on python-keystoneclient.

Upper bound in Cinder's requires for keystoneclient
now fails due to updates made to keystoneclient and the
fact that other projects aren't setting this bound.

The result is that 0.3 is pulled in from other projects
and as a result Cinder startup fails.

Fixes bug: 1197571

Change-Id: I696e7c94358ed3d049640e92838984cdd86a1bcc
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove upper bound on python-keystoneclient.

Upper bound in Cinder's requires for keystoneclient
now fails due to updates made to keystoneclient and the
fact that other projects aren't setting this bound.

The result is that 0.3 is pulled in from other projects
and as a result Cinder startup fails.

Fixes bug: 1197571

Change-Id: I696e7c94358ed3d049640e92838984cdd86a1bcc

commit_message:
Refactors select_destinations to return HostState objects

This is needed because we will need to pass 'limits'
(resource oversubscription values for the compute host)
attribute along with filter_properties to the compute manager.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: Ide3a9781f66f961ff4aceadc00275de91c6c1030

commit_message:
Add fill_faults() batch operation to InstanceList

This method will let us query the database a single time to fetch
and fill the instance.fault property of every instance in a list.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I89d2056012e5bda7bc30e298e3abef07329cfa73

subject: Make api_samples reboot test use a plausible scenario
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-30 22:05:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make api_samples reboot test use a plausible scenario

The idiot that wrote this test (me) implemented an invalid
sequence of events where a soft reboot follows a hard reboot,
which isn't allowed. I think the only reason this was passing
was because the instance dict in the api gets copied enough
times to avoid actually accounting for the state properly.

With the forthcoming objects patch, the accounting is tighter
and this impossibility gets caught.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I7d08025df6f7895c97f84e8929a551ddede9f9ad

commit_message:
Make api_samples reboot test use a plausible scenario

The idiot that wrote this test (me) implemented an invalid
sequence of events where a soft reboot follows a hard reboot,
which isn't allowed. I think the only reason this was passing
was because the instance dict in the api gets copied enough
times to avoid actually accounting for the state properly.

With the forthcoming objects patch, the accounting is tighter
and this impossibility gets caught.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I7d08025df6f7895c97f84e8929a551ddede9f9ad

subject: Fix compute_api object handling code in cells messaging
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 15:35:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix compute_api object handling code in cells messaging

This fixes the calling convention for _from_db_object() in the
object handling code for calling compute_api in cells. It also
changes the guinea pig method from reboot to get, which doesn't

commit_message:
Fix compute_api object handling code in cells messaging

This fixes the calling convention for _from_db_object() in the
object handling code for calling compute_api in cells. It also
changes the guinea pig method from reboot to backup so that
we can convert reboot to objects in a few patches.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I9d359cb13fc054375c2a7c1e45e6770f274c8449

[{'created': '2013-06-19 00:26:33.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-object-storage-dev/src/docbkx/object-api-storage-container-svc.xml'], 'message': "Small fix to description of container GET.

The text said that you'd get a 2xx response if the container was
empty, but didn't say anything about when the container was
nonempty. Well, you get a 2xx whether the container is empty or not,
so now the text reflects that.

Thanks to Clay Gerrard for spotting this.

Change-Id: Ib0a37d6a3689834fa799ffe51988add3453fb746
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Small fix to description of container GET.

The text said that you'd get a 2xx response if the container was
empty, but didn't say anything about when the container was
nonempty. Well, you get a 2xx whether the container is empty or not,
so now the text reflects that.

Thanks to Clay Gerrard for spotting this.

Change-Id: Ib0a37d6a3689834fa799ffe51988add3453fb746

Add support to linuxbridge manifests for Red Hat distros

This mirrors the change that was done for the OVS plugin/agent.
In addition, defaults for sql_connection and network_vlan_ranges
that mirror the ones for the OVS plugin were added.

commit_message:
Ensure 'id' is included by keystone_tenant.instances.

 * Previously keystone_tenant was only including the 'name' field
   in the results of instances().  This patch includes the 'id'
   field to allow discovery of id from the name.

Change-Id: Ibd5b22f6b29bc0f07e5c3c1cd52a404d32ea0b89

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-03 23:42:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Lookup tenant id via keystone_tenant.instances

commit_message:
Lookup tenant id via keystone_tenant.instances

 * Previously tenant_id was being looked up via the catalog,
   but that precludes the tenant being created in the same run
   as the quantum resource.  Using instances ensures that the id
   can always be looked up by the name.

Change-Id: I038edc10e38c4edacb4f40c446bf75156b2af882

commit_message:
Replace run_tests.sh helper script with tox.

 * Added installation of tox - the preferred way to repeatedly
   run tempest.
 * Removed unnecessary run_tests.sh script - replaced by tox.
 * Added setup_venv parameter to enable automatic creation of a
   venv installed with tempest dependencies for debugging purposes.

Change-Id: I729d041a606810ba2e60543855a44f0e10870c0b

 * Previously the glance image ids were always looked up from the
   name, even if the ids were provided to the manifest.
   This change only looks up the ids if they are not provided.
 * The configure_images parameter has been added to allow skipping
   the lookup of image ids by name.
 * The image_name_alt parameter has been added to allow the
   alternate image to vary from the default image.

   provisioning is no longer performed by tempest, no assumptions

commit_message:
Fix configuration of glance images.

 * Previously the glance image ids were always looked up from the
   name, even if the ids were provided to the manifest.
   This change only looks up the ids if they are not provided.
 * The configure_images parameter has been added to allow skipping
   the lookup of image ids by name.
 * The image_name_alt parameter has been added to allow the
   alternate image to vary from the default image.
 * Default image names are no longer provided.  Since the
   provisioning is no longer performed by tempest, no assumptions
   can be made about the results of that step.

Change-Id: I518f1c58a3e7417e60456fa9485d5d13fe002696

commit_message:
Remove provisioning from the default manifest.

 * Separating out provisioning of users, tenants and images leaves
   the door open for reuse of the tempest configuration by other
   provisioning schemes.

Change-Id: I1878bd0b518d61c25a33ec329bcc436eb1163749

commit_message:
Format resource required_by in resource-show.

This change has no effect if the resource details contains
no requires key (such as for older API versions).

Change-Id: I5bce5cf6a7c7cd3f531453cd126fb7b7b3e227ef

commit_message:
Make instance_update() string-convert IP addresses

Since postgres is strongly typed, it gets annoyed if we pass our
netaddr.IPAddress objects to it for an update. This makes the
instance_update() operation string-convert those before passing
them to the sqlalchemy save method.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Ie9d4a59f50e59e80e88a8bb88575b89ce2e59091

commit_message:
Fix 50-firmware.rules no such file on Fedora 19

systemd on Fedora 19 has made /lib/udev/rules.d/50-firmware.rules
optional:
http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/systemd-devel/2013-March/009708.html

Firmware is now handled by the in-kernel loader.

Added a file exist check for Fedora 19 and any other distros that
may have dropped the rules file. Backwards compatible with existing
distros.

Fixes: bug #1196409

Change-Id: I1d2acf3f88543736d75eb2e8766e83a3da194638

commit_message:
Add conditional exception reraise

In some cases we need to save an exception and reraise it only
under certain conditions.  As written, the
save_and_reraise_exception context always reraises, which means
it can't always be used.  This change adds a flag that allows
conditional reraising to address the limitation.

Change-Id: Ib5c6406a1b91daff94cc4aa305dcb7d6262aecdc

commit_message:
Improve postfix element.

Changes 09-* files to 59-* to ensure they run after OCA.
Adds templates for main.cf and mailname to allow configuration of hostname
and delay_wait_time. The current code has the DIB hostname from chroot
at build time in these files preventing local mail delivery.

Fixes bug 1195931
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I62badfddac3f6c29f484790c8ebf58f282d597c9

commit_message:
Fix binding of SQL query params in DB utils.

We should not rely on string.format() or % string formatting
when binding params of SQL queries. This particular case is
trivial and the input is completely controlled by a developer,
but we should always be pedantic to encourage good coding practices.

Change-Id: I3c44aa722681e3b80e95641a296e7e1f1a463a8a

subject: Restore should use pgrep instead of mysqladmin to check for mysql down
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 739, 'name': 'Michael Basnight', 'email': 'mbasnight@gmail.com', 'username': 'hubcap'}, {'_account_id': 1375, 'name': 'Ed Cranford', 'email': 'ed.cranford@gmail.com', 'username': 'ed--cranford'}, {'_account_id': 1925, 'name': 'Vipul Sabhaya', 'email': 'vipuls@gmail.com', 'username': 'vipuls'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 5390, 'name': 'Steve Leon', 'username': 'steve-leon', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 21:49:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Restore should use pgrep instead of mysqladmin to check for mysql up

For a short window, while mysql is shutting down, it stops accepting
network connections but the mysqld process is still alive.

During this window mysqladmin ping reports that mysql is down and
trying to start mysql fails with:
"mysqld_safe A mysqld process already exists"

Using pgrep to check for mysql up on restore fixes this issue.

Fixes bug: 1197161

Change-Id: Id8b8e15b4b6136c8acbc3cac17691a65a1a4ed14
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-02 21:49:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Restore should use pgrep instead of mysqladmin to check for mysql up

For a short window, while mysql is shutting down, it stops accepting
network connections but the mysqld process is still alive.

During this window mysqladmin ping reports that mysql is down and
trying to start mysql fails with:
"mysqld_safe A mysqld process already exists"

Using pgrep to check for mysql up on restore fixes this issue.

Fixes bug: 1197161

Change-Id: Id8b8e15b4b6136c8acbc3cac17691a65a1a4ed14
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-03 16:01:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Restore should use pgrep instead of mysqladmin to check for mysql down

For a short window, while mysql is shutting down, it stops accepting
network connections but the mysqld process is still alive.

During this window mysqladmin ping reports that mysql is down and
trying to start mysql fails with:
"mysqld_safe A mysqld process already exists"

Use pgrep (during restore) instead of mysqladmin ping to check mysql
is down to fix this.

Fixes bug: 1197161

Change-Id: Id8b8e15b4b6136c8acbc3cac17691a65a1a4ed14

commit_message:
Restore should use pgrep instead of mysqladmin to check for mysql down

For a short window, while mysql is shutting down, it stops accepting
network connections but the mysqld process is still alive.

During this window mysqladmin ping reports that mysql is down and
trying to start mysql fails with:
"mysqld_safe A mysqld process already exists"

Use pgrep (during restore) instead of mysqladmin ping to check mysql
is down to fix this.

Fixes bug: 1197161

Change-Id: Id8b8e15b4b6136c8acbc3cac17691a65a1a4ed14

commit_message:
Added functionality for nova hooks pass functions

Nova hooks do not pass the function they wrap to the hook
as a parameter. This patch adds an optional parameter to
add_hook which will change the function signatures for pre
and post, enabling hooks to acquire and use information
about the function they are wrapped around.

Additionally adds a unit test for the new hooks in test_hooks.py.

Change-Id: Ie328b2460ef0e063892944c97934c12076ed4979

commit_message:
xenapi: Add configurable BitTorrent URL fetcher

Add configurable torrent URL fetcher for sourcing image torrents.

The code uses entry points to find a "driver" style function.  If no
driver is supplied, the torrent file will continue to be found at:

CONF.xenapi_torrent_base_url + "/" + image_id + ".torrent"

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib2b90c32a5b2c20dd1863058cf1a523672cf2fb3

subject: Remove dynamic serialization switching
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 18:06:20.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/utils/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove dynamic serialization switching

The code for dynamic serialization switching can be tricked into
behaving incorrectly. For instance, a request for .../1.1.2 will
appear to be a request to serialize to troff (".2"). This is not the
desired behavior.

The dynamic serialization switching feature should be re-implemented
at another level of the stack, or should use a different separation
character, e.g. '?'.

Fixes: bug #1197479
Change-Id: I4610b620f52f5eefad65dcbeaa3114bc43547ba2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove dynamic serialization switching

The code for dynamic serialization switching can be tricked into
behaving incorrectly. For instance, a request for .../1.1.2 will
appear to be a request to serialize to troff (".2"). This is not the
desired behavior.

The dynamic serialization switching feature should be re-implemented
at another level of the stack, or should use a different separation
character, e.g. '?'.

Fixes: bug #1197479
Change-Id: I4610b620f52f5eefad65dcbeaa3114bc43547ba2

commit_message:
Clarify the compute API is_volume_backed_instance method

Update the is_volume_backed_instance to be more robust and
check for volume_id or snapshot_id to see if a block device
mapping is really backed by a cinder volume. As per the blueprint
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/BlockDeviceConfig#snapshot_id_and_volume_id
I used the volume_id to do this as seems consistent with the
rest of the tests.

Add unit test to enforce this.

The motivation behind this is that we rely on this method at HP and
the test ServersActionsAllJsonTest.test_server_create_image
in nova.tests.integrated.test_api_samples highlighted weakness in
this method and where it could fail now that every instance has an
associated block device mapping for its root device.

Change-Id: Ia4b623a94d0285d8aeb97e9fd72a63f5f87efe7a

commit_message:
Add LBaaS Support

Since OpenStack Quantum has a LBaaS agent in Grizzly release,
this patch install and configure it with the default driver : HAproxy.

Change-Id: I68af63c33f6f5cd712a66dc747d3da8d01222aeb

subject: Refactor virt drivers' poll_rebooting_instances()
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-30 22:05:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Refactor virt drivers' poll_rebooting_instances()

Right now, each driver is (apparently) required to issue the
compute_api.reboot() call on each instance it wants to reboot
(which is all of them in all cases). This refactors them to
return a list of the instances they indeed wish to have rebooted,
which consolidates the reboot call to a single place. This
will make it easier to fix the db access violation bug, as well
as make it easier to convert compute_api.reboot() to objects.

commit_message:
Refactor virt drivers' poll_rebooting_instances()

Right now, each driver is (apparently) required to issue the
compute_api.reboot() call on each instance it wants to reboot
(which is all of them in all cases). This refactors them to
return a list of the instances they indeed wish to have rebooted,
which consolidates the reboot call to a single place. This
will make it easier to fix the db access violation bug, as well
as make it easier to convert compute_api.reboot() to objects.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I8529499895a98dde6c6f147472b998f0c8f5be86

commit_message:
Fix grizzly compat issue in conducor rpc api

When a new parameter was added in revision
0d5fb06b39e8244429be72f05e2066d24572dc2e, it did not properly account
for rpc client side version control added for compatibility during a
rolling upgrade.  This patch adds the ability to send the older message
version if configured to do so.

Change-Id: Iaadd4890099c12883b4a29a6b049cc672a669f93

commit_message:
powervm: make get_host_uptime output consistent with other virt drivers

The powervm driver was filtering out part of the uptime information so
that only system uptime was returned, not the number of users, load,
etc. The hypervisor API sample and the libvirt driver provide the full
uptime output, so this patch makes the powervm driver follow that
convention.

Fixes bug 1196630

Change-Id: I24134270cab9df97ff59c06e057406b4aa09992a

commit_message:
Import Sphinx theme for OpenStack

This is a copy of the Sphinx theme for OpenStack developer
documentation imported from the ceilometer repository. After
this library is released, we will remove the copies of the
theme from all of the other repositories.

blueprint oslo.sphinx

Change-Id: I20b6c224b8d8fbede354c2a28ad67eda3a4b9dac
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

subject: Rework deletion of insecure users
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-02 15:54:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rework deletion of insecure users

Due to a bug in MySQL [1] -- or possibly the Ubuntu MySQL server
packages -- issuing a call to DROP USER fails consistently when
provisioning a node with the recipes/mysql-server.rb recipe.

This reworks the DROP USER to a DELETE call on the mysql.user
table. Note that the DROP USER is preferred over the call to
manually DELETE FROM mysql.user because Galera cluster does not
replicate DELETE events on MyISAM tables but does replicate
DROP USER events [2]. So, when the MySQL bug is fixed or a
workaround is found, we should revert this patch.

[1] http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=69644
[2] http://www.codership.com/wiki/doku.php?id=limitations

Change-Id: I0fab1a0f85d55eab96984064131d14a21b2236e3
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-02 18:24:44.000000000', 'files': ['Berksfile.lock', 'recipes/mysql-server.rb', 'spec/mysql-server_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Rework deletion of insecure users

packages -- issuing a call to DROP USER fails consistently when
provisioning a node with the recipes/mysql-server.rb recipe.

This reworks the DROP USER to a DELETE call on the mysql.user
table. Note that the DROP USER is preferred over the call to
manually DELETE FROM mysql.user because Galera cluster does not
replicate DELETE events on MyISAM tables but does replicate
DROP USER events [2]. So, when the MySQL bug is fixed or a
workaround is found, we should revert this patch.

[1] http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=69644
[2] http://www.codership.com/wiki/doku.php?id=limitations

Change-Id: I0fab1a0f85d55eab96984064131d14a21b2236e3
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Rework deletion of insecure users

Due to a bug in MySQL [1] -- or possibly the Ubuntu MySQL server
packages -- issuing a call to DROP USER fails consistently when
provisioning a node with the recipes/mysql-server.rb recipe.

This reworks the DROP USER to a DELETE call on the mysql.user
table. Note that the DROP USER is preferred over the call to
manually DELETE FROM mysql.user because Galera cluster does not
replicate DELETE events on MyISAM tables but does replicate
DROP USER events [2]. So, when the MySQL bug is fixed or a
workaround is found, we should revert this patch.

[1] http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=69644
[2] http://www.codership.com/wiki/doku.php?id=limitations

Change-Id: I0fab1a0f85d55eab96984064131d14a21b2236e3

commit_message:
update xen/vmware virt drivers not to hit db directly

This change replaces calls to compute api with calls to
conductor api updated with a 'compute_reboot' function.

Fix for bug 1177993

Change-Id: I9aefba95cce29c1486fdfb25008f8da9ece1c19b

commit_message:
Add common messaging attributes

Similar to the way in which we handle database attributes, provide a
mechanism that allows for centralized messaging configuration. Right
now this supports rabbit, but there is no reason other message queues
could not be added in the default['openstack']['mq'] namespace.

Change-Id: Id9d34fa7c256920dd575eee57c7b3820dacf8068

This was a mistake on my part adding this method.  The rabbit-host
directive takes a host, not a host and port.  We are going to lock
0.3.0 version of this library Monday, and not add any minor features.
Wanted to delete this confusing method, before we lock this version

Change-Id: Ibc48fc267f2b0a1ee83963f49818edbd67adaca2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Removed `#rabbit_server` method

This was a mistake on my part adding this method.  The rabbit-host
directive takes a host, not a host and port.  We are going to lock
0.3.0 version of this library Monday, and not add any minor features.
Wanted to delete this confusing method, before we lock this version
down.

Change-Id: Ibc48fc267f2b0a1ee83963f49818edbd67adaca2

commit_message:
Remove ifup from the nova-bm-dnsmasq.service

After d9a4ea36e10750f09c4bdd667f060d10aaa7c69b the init-quantum script
is no longer creating network configure files causing the ifup command
on the nova-bm-dnsmasq.service to fail

Change-Id: I8d650fdffac8b12ce0de9ae4852ceb41967656f3

subject: Remove boot-stacks dependency on openstack-db
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-03 17:30:16.000000000', 'files': ['elements/boot-stack/install.d/01-boot-stack', 'elements/boot-stack/element-deps'], 'message': "Remove boot-stacks dependency on openstack-db

Everything provided by the openstack-db element is already done in the
boot-stack elemnt or one of it dependencies. So it shouldn't be included
as a dependency.

The only piece that is missing is the line the installs the cinder
service because boot-stack doesn't depend on cinder. The cinder element
currently seems to not be working. So I'm placing that line to install the
cinder service in the boot-stack element, this can be removed again once
the cinder element is working.

This will allow me to make progress on using the new source-interface,
as multiple elements will no longer be adding the same service.

Change-Id: I808a580cb8731c83fff6dd50e72db4a29150a74e
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-03 17:30:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove boot-stacks dependency on openstack-db

Everything provided by the openstack-db element is already done in the
boot-stack elemnt or one of it dependencies. So it shouldn't be included
as a dependency.

The only piece that is missing is the line the installs the cinder
service because boot-stack doesn't depend on cinder. The cinder element
currently seems to not be working. So I'm placing that line to install the
cinder service in the boot-stack element, this can be removed again once
the cinder element is working.

This will allow me to make progress on using the new source-interface,
as multiple elements will no longer be adding the same service.

Change-Id: I808a580cb8731c83fff6dd50e72db4a29150a74e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove boot-stacks dependency on openstack-db

Everything provided by the openstack-db element is already done in the
boot-stack elemnt or one of it dependencies. So it shouldn't be included
as a dependency.

The only piece that is missing is the line the installs the cinder
service because boot-stack doesn't depend on cinder. The cinder element
currently seems to not be working. So I'm placing that line to install the
cinder service in the boot-stack element, this can be removed again once
the cinder element is working.

This will allow me to make progress on using the new source-interface,
as multiple elements will no longer be adding the same service.

Change-Id: I808a580cb8731c83fff6dd50e72db4a29150a74e

commit_message:
Replace sys.exit by a RPCException

This change replace sys.exit by a RPCException like the zmq
implementation does, to allow library users to handle the case of the
rpc failure in their applications.

Change-Id: Iafda7bfa20840fa5488dece1d5ad49e2b14b73b5

commit_message:
Use event.listen() instead of deprecated listeners kwarg

The listeners kwarg is deprecated in SQLAlchemy 0.7.0.
Use the new event.listen() method instead.

Instead of using the original approach of testing whether or not the string
'mysql' is in 'connection_dict.drivername', now we are using a more direct
string equality test to ensure that engine.name == 'mysql' before passing
it to sql.event.listen().

We've decided to change the name of our ping_listener function to reflect its
purpose more accurately. Its name has been changed from "ping_listener" to
"mysql_on_checkout".

Change-Id: Ib9ef52404e3d474a60cdc82e8fcf8c6a9616bce3
Fixes: bug #1031405

With this patch we  avoid masking NotImplementedError(s).
Previously, a catch-all clause returned 500, and it makes
sense to distinguish between genuine 500 errors (i.e. a bug),
versus 501 ones.

This opens up the issue of keeping the server behavior
consistent from one release to another, but one might argue
that this was bad design decision in the first place.

Fixes bug 1197200

Change-Id: I2d81cba5ee9e5fbe8e865378381790b5b467d255
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not mask NotImplementedError exceptions

With this patch we  avoid masking NotImplementedError(s).
Previously, a catch-all clause returned 500, and it makes
sense to distinguish between genuine 500 errors (i.e. a bug),
versus 501 ones.

This opens up the issue of keeping the server behavior
consistent from one release to another, but one might argue
that this was bad design decision in the first place.

Fixes bug 1197200

Change-Id: I2d81cba5ee9e5fbe8e865378381790b5b467d255

subject: Enable Fedora 19 on DevStack
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-30 23:13:21.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'stack.sh'], 'message': 'Enable Fedora 19 on DevStack

Fedora uses a special PROMPT_COMMAND for screen terminal types,
which are the default with DevStack.  The PROMPT_COMMAND interacts
in a negative way with the -t and -X and -p flags, causing DevStack
not to work.  To solve this problem, this patch forces PROMPT_COMMAND
to default to /bin/true, triggering no changes to the window title
used within screen.  Also this patch enables F19 as a non-FORCE
distribution.

Change-Id: I2414d9e28dd95b69272e132163b29ed83f73b2f6
Fixes: bug #1196340
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable Fedora 19 on DevStack

Fedora uses a special PROMPT_COMMAND for screen terminal types,
which are the default with DevStack.  The PROMPT_COMMAND interacts
in a negative way with the -t and -X and -p flags, causing DevStack
not to work.  To solve this problem, this patch forces PROMPT_COMMAND
to default to /bin/true, triggering no changes to the window title
used within screen.  Also this patch enables F19 as a non-FORCE
distribution.

Change-Id: I2414d9e28dd95b69272e132163b29ed83f73b2f6
Fixes: bug #1196340

commit_message:
Fix metadata for create in child cell

Metadata can be passed as a list from parent cell. Make sure to convert
it to a dict before calling instance_create() in the child cell.

This also adjusts the previous similar fix for system_metadata to make
sure to not drop any sys_meta that was passed down.

Fixes bug 1197166

Change-Id: I38937ebe5ae81158d51992f4efd047531b53302c

commit_message:
Removed the use of non-standard ohai plugin

We now have a helper method `#address_for` to return the
IP of a given interface. Switched out the ohai use
in favor of `#address_for`. Also, updated berkshelf
to 2.x which handles dep resolution correctly. I run
into problems getting berkshelf to lock to the new 0.3.0
openstack-common w/o updating berkshelf.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-18 08:37:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix vol_usage_update() DB API method and tests.

vol_usage_update() method filters VolumeCache instances by
value of 'volume_id' column, which is of type varchar(36).
The problem is that a caller can pass 'volume_id' argument
as an integer value. On PostgreSQL this leads to the following
error when the SQL query is executed:

    ProgrammingError: (ProgrammingError) operator does not exist:
                      character varying = integer
    LINE 3: WHERE volume_usage_cache.volume_id = 1

vol_usage_update() is modified to convert the argument to a string
to prevent errors if an integer value is passed by mistake. Tests
are updated to show the proper usage of the method.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: I5ff1fa36d5494a15ec8b3bc1bfa9bb1c1af9fe97

commit_message:
Fix vol_usage_update() DB API tests.

vol_usage_update() method filters VolumeCache instances by
value of 'volume_id' column, which is of type varchar(36).
The problem is that a caller can pass 'volume_id' argument
as an integer value. On PostgreSQL this leads to the following
error when the SQL query is executed:

    ProgrammingError: (ProgrammingError) operator does not exist:
                      character varying = integer
    LINE 3: WHERE volume_usage_cache.volume_id = 1

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: I5ff1fa36d5494a15ec8b3bc1bfa9bb1c1af9fe97

commit_message:
Rename "manager" to "conductor"

This rename to "conductor" more clearly communicates that this service
has a many-to-many relationship. One or more service instances
coordinate between each other to conduct actions on a set of nodes,
using guarded locks to prevent conflicting simultaneous actions on any
given node. The old name "manager" suggested a more one-to-many relationship,
which is not the design pattern which we use here.

Rename ironic/manager to ironic/conductor
Rename ironic.manager.manager.ManagerService
    to ironic.conductor.manager.ConductorManager
Rename ironic-manager to ironic-conductor
Update docs too

Change-Id: I3191be72a44bdaf14c763ce7519a7ae9066b2bc5

subject: Add pre-authentication in swift command.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-27 16:45:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add pre-authentication in swift command.

Swift command passes a new connection each time it performs
an action. In case user specifies authentication creds in
the arguments, authentication is performed at each action.
When user passes pre-auth information the bandwith seems
to be much higher, it excludes the autehntication time.

Bandwith should not include authentication time.
This change provides an authentication prior to performing
an action. It is done only once with each connection, and
then proceeds as if user passed pre-auth information.
The change increases the performance. It also allows
re-tries due to authentication creds presence.

Change-Id: Ib789774a8b2e1716ba5fa787505fca54cc2dfbd1
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-07-01 09:52:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add pre-authentication in swift command.

Swift command passes a new connection each time it performs
an action. In case user specifies authentication creds in
the arguments, authentication is performed at each action.
When user passes pre-auth information the bandwith seems
to be much higher, it excludes the autehntication time.

Bandwith should not include authentication time.
This change provides an authentication prior to performing
an action. It is done only once with each connection, and
then proceeds as if user passed pre-auth information.
The change increases the performance. It also allows
re-tries due to authentication creds presence.

Also added auth option to enable self-authentication.
It returns token and storage url.

Change-Id: Ib789774a8b2e1716ba5fa787505fca54cc2dfbd1
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-07-01 09:56:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add pre-authentication in swift command.

Swift command passes a new connection each time it performs
an action. In case user specifies authentication creds in
the arguments, authentication is performed at each action.
When user passes pre-auth information the bandwith seems
to be much higher, it excludes the autehntication time.

Bandwith should not include authentication time.
This change provides an authentication prior to performing
an action. It is done only once with each connection, and
then proceeds as if user passed pre-auth information.
The change increases the performance. It also allows
re-tries due to authentication creds presence.

Also added auth option to enable self-authentication.
It returns token and storage url.

Change-Id: Ib789774a8b2e1716ba5fa787505fca54cc2dfbd1
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-07-03 13:03:44.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift'], 'message': "Add pre-authentication in swift command.

We noticed a difference in download bandwidth while using
authentication details and pre-auth information for download.
Download using authentication details included authentication
time into the download bandwidth at each call of the function.
This time should have been exluded from download bandwidth.

This patch set is fixing the problem by authenticating only
once - before Connection object is used anywhere further - and
then overriding Connection object's parametres with the new
pre-auth information. Then whenever Connection is used,
authentication steps are ommited.

The fix generally improves performance by decreasing number of
calls into the get_auth function as well as fixes the command
to report correct bandwidth. For convenience reasons also
added auth command in case user wants to obtain auth token
and storage url using only the swift tool.

Change-Id: Ib789774a8b2e1716ba5fa787505fca54cc2dfbd1
", 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Add pre-authentication in swift command.

We noticed a difference in download bandwidth while using
authentication details and pre-auth information for download.
Download using authentication details included authentication
time into the download bandwidth at each call of the function.
This time should have been exluded from download bandwidth.

This patch set is fixing the problem by authenticating only
once - before Connection object is used anywhere further - and
then overriding Connection object's parametres with the new
pre-auth information. Then whenever Connection is used,
authentication steps are ommited.

The fix generally improves performance by decreasing number of
calls into the get_auth function as well as fixes the command
to report correct bandwidth. For convenience reasons also
added auth command in case user wants to obtain auth token
and storage url using only the swift tool.

Change-Id: Ib789774a8b2e1716ba5fa787505fca54cc2dfbd1

This is the lower bound version of websockify required for NovaWebSocketProxy
See bug #1195700

commit_message:
Ability to ignore db migrations

There are cases where migrations should not be executed.  For example when
upgrading a zone, and the image database is replicated across many zones.
Having the ability to toggle migration execution is useful (and a use-case
we have :))

commit_message:
Ability to ignore db migrations

There are cases where migrations should not be executed. For example when
upgrading a zone, and the identity database is replicated across many zones.
Having the ability to toggle migration execution is useful (and a use-case
we have :))

Change-Id: I9d820e853d8afa13a55dbd49e5335d34246d97ba

commit_message:
Private key for user hadoop in vanilla plugin.

Write cluster-wide private key and authorized_keys for user hadoop in
the Vanilla plugin.
This is the same key we use in
instances.py#_generate_user_data_script().

There's going to be corresponding fix in savanna dib elements.

Partially fixes: bug #1188442
Implements: blueprint avoid-keypair-in-dib-scripts

Change-Id: I81b98053d4176d7f87bf9ed1b7e64eea6994562d

commit_message:
Virtual power driver is superceded by ssh driver

Equivalent functionality was added in ironic/drivers/modules/ssh.py
previously, in commit Ie24564e349aca863578955385f084f1be8b0b053,
but the corresponding nova files were not removed. This patch simply
removes these unneeded files.

commit_message:
Port from nova: Fix local variable 'root_uuid' ref

Port I0221984ce4f7c406990315ef820d9ce63fc6e015 from Nova.

Fixes an issue where the root_uuid variable gets used
before it is assigned.

Instead of generating NameError, log a more descriptive error
and allow the exception to be raised.

Fixes LP Bug #1190269.

Change-Id: Icecac7443d296546734f7a13995530a7991b9f04

commit_message:
Add support for configuring '4-$' of vcpu_pin_set

Fixes bug 1196424
'4-$' means pin vcpus from pcpu 4 to the last, this is convenient
to cloud admin, with this he doesn't need know how many pcpus on
the compute node.

Change-Id: I7a4936b54e0113d88da1a93b6637f507d44cf9d4

commit_message:
Adds support for building generic reporting

Adds a framework for building a text, xml, and json
reports by creating models and generators to generate
those models, and then serializing them by attaching
and running views.  Included is code for generating
the Guru Meditation Reports like in
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GuruMeditationReport

Implements: bp guru-meditation-report
Fixes: bug #1189570
Change-Id: Ie0ab6aa66bafe017507083e024a328bc52ef8bb0

As per discussions from bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/999084 and
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27593/

am proposing a change to remove these tests since

1. Passwords are optional
